etomica.virial.cluster

Class ClusterDiagram

  • java.lang.Object
    • etomica.virial.cluster.ClusterDiagram
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class ClusterDiagram
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Holds information about a cluster diagram, including the bonds, root points, and score.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructs a cluster having numBody points of which numRootPoints are root points, with bonds between each pair of points (full star).

        public boolean isRootPoint(int i)
        returns true if the given point is a root point

      • getNumConnections

        public int getNumConnections()
        returns the number of active connections in the cluster.

      • getWeight

        public Rational getWeight()

      • setWeight

        public void setWeight(Rational weight)

      • makeFullStar

        public void makeFullStar()
        Turns this cluster into a full star -- each point in the cluster is connected to every other point in the cluster.

      • swap

        public void swap(int point1,
                 int point2)
        Swaps point1 and point2. Point1 points to everything point2 pointed to and vice-versa. Also, everything that pointed to point1 points to point2 and vice-versa. Don't swap root and non-root points.

      • deleteConnection

        public boolean deleteConnection(int node1,
                                int node2)
        Deletes a connection from one node1 to node2. The method should be called again to delete the connection from node2 to node1.

      • addConnection

        public void addConnection(int node1,
                          int node2)
        Adds a connection between the node1 and node2. The method should be called again to create the connection from the node2 to node1.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • scoreGreaterThan

        protected boolean scoreGreaterThan(int[] compareScore)
        Determines if the cluster's current configuration has a score greater than the given score. The current score is computed only enough to determine if it is less than the current cluster.

      • calcScore

        public void calcScore(int[] score)
        compute a score for the cluster. The score is returned as an array of integers. The first element is the score for connections between i and i+1 and the second element is the score for connections between i and i+2 (the zeroth element is always 0). The score puts more importance on early points (having a connection for point 0 will score one higher than having the same connection for every other point). The score is returned in the array passed in.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the cluster to being fully connected except that root points are not connected to each other. If the cluster is being generated from a ClusterGenerator, ClusterGenerator.reset should be called instead of this method.

      • sort

        public void sort()
        Sorts list of connections for each node in the diagram such that mConnections[i][j] < mConnections[i][k] for k > j.

      • isIsomorphOf

        public boolean isIsomorphOf(ClusterDiagram anotherCluster)
        Returns true if this cluster is an isomorph of the given cluster. That is, returns true if the given cluster can be mapped onto this one by some permutation of the field points.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
